content:
• Thursday, March 16, 2017
  • VUZI

    Vuzix -4.2% after hours, notes material weakness ongoing as of December 2016

    • Vuzix observes, through preparation of financial statements, existence of ineffective disclosure controls and procedures and internal reporting controls as of December 31, 2016, items prospectively causative of future material misstatements. Vuzix (NASDAQ:VUZI) $6.90 after hours.
    • 10-K
     
     
     
     
    | 6:25 PM | 57 Comments
  • RYN

    Rayonier buys $217M in southern coastal timberlands, to offer 5M shares

    • Rayonier (NYSE:RYN) -3% AH after agreeing to acquire ~95,100 acres of high-quality industrial timberlands in the southeastern U.S. for a combined $217M.
    • RYN says the Acquisitions are comprised of highly productive timberlands located in some of the strongest timber markets in the South, primarily along the I-95 coastal corridor near Savannah, Ga.
    • To help fund the deal, RYN launches a public offering of 5M common shares, with an underwriters option to purchase up to an additional 750K shares.
     
     
     
     
    | 6:17 PM | 3 Comments
  • BHC

    Valeant Pharma jumps AH as ValueAct adds 3M shares to stake

    • Valeant Pharmaceuticals (VRX) +4.3% AH on news that ValueAct Capital bought another 3M shares in the company, according to a 13D filing.
    • The purchase brings ValueAct's stake in VRX to nearly 18M shares, or 5.2%, making it the company's second largest shareholder after Paulson & Co., which owns 5.68%.
    • ValueAct purchased its shares on March 14 at $10.81-$10.88 and follows Bill Ackman's recent liquidation of his position.
     
     
     
     
    | 5:58 PM | 130 Comments

  • After Hours Gainers / Losers

    • Top gainers, as of 5.25 p.m.: AVXS +11.3%. VSLR +7.3%. OMER +6.0%. FATE +5.6%. FRSH +4.7%.
    • Top losers, as of 5.25p.m.: CAL -8.6%. AOI -7.2%. RST -6.0%. SXC -5.8%. MRO -5.1%.
     
     
     
     
    | 5:35 PM | 1 Comment
  • MOFG

    MidWestOne Financial -5% on share sale

    • A trust controlled by board Chairman John Morrison is selling stock (amount not disclosed). The company will receive no proceeds from the sale.
    • MOFG -5.1% after hours
     
     
     
     
    | 4:29 PM
  • ADBE

    Adobe Systems +4.2%; Q1 2017, forecasts positive

    • Q1 2017 results – revenue $1.68B (+21.7% Y/Y, $30M above estimates), EPS $0.94 ($0.07 above estimates), Digital Media revenue $1.14B, Creative revenue $942M, Digital Media ARR [annualized recurring revenue] $4.25B (+$265M sequentially), Adobe Marketing Cloud revenue $477M, operating income +40% Y/Y, net income +42% Y/Y, cash flow from operations $730M, deferred revenue $2.1B, share repurchases $238M (2.2M shares)
    • Q2 2017 projections – revenue $1.73B (consensus $1.72B), EPS $0.94 (consensus $0.91), non-operating other expense $15M, tax rate 21%, share count 499M
    • After hours – (NASDAQ:ADBE) $127.50
    • Press release / conference call / earnings slides / data sheet / 8-K
     
     
     
     
    | 4:26 PM
  • AVXS

    AveXis misses by $0.12

    • AveXis (NASDAQ:AVXS): Q4 EPS of -$0.92 misses by $0.12.
    • Press Release
     
     
     
     
    | 4:19 PM | 2 Comments
  • ADBE

    Adobe Systems beats by $0.07, beats on revenue

    • Adobe Systems (NASDAQ:ADBE): FQ1 EPS of $0.94 beats by $0.07.
    • Revenue of $1.68B (+21.7% Y/Y) beats by $30M.
    • Shares +1.3%.
    • Press Release

    MannKind beats by $0.76, beats on revenue

    • MannKind (NASDAQ:MNKD): Q4 EPS of $0.56 beats by $0.76.
    • Revenue of $12.4M beats by $6.4M.
    • Shares +6.3%.
    • Press Release

  • CSBR

    Champions Oncology reports Q4 results

    • Champions Oncology (NASDAQ:CSBR): Q4 EPS of -$0.11
    • Revenue of $3.57M (+40.0% Y/Y)
    • Shares +1.6%.
    • Press Release
     
     
     
     
    | 4:03 PM | 3 Comments
  • ORCL

    JMP Securities upgrades Oracle from Underperform

    • Amid assorted price target raises and buy-equivalent rating reiterations (as well as an upgrade to Overweight at J.P. Morgan) subsequent Oracle's (NYSE:ORCL) Q3 2017 reporting indicating strength in cloud segments, JMP Securities analyst Patrick Walravens modifies view from negative, though notes concerns persist over auditing tactics, customer satisfaction rates and cloud competition.
    • Additionally factors SaaS/PaaS unit scale that's nearing that of the company's declining new license business and Oracle's valuation gap (15x CY18 P/E multiple) relative to Microsoft (19x), SAP (21x), Adobe Systems (25x) and elsewhere. Given share gains of roughly 6% post-earnings, considers present trade levels fair value.
    • Previously (March 15, 2017): Oracle +3.4%; Q3 2017 cloud performance headlines, dividend raised
     
     
     
     
    | 3:59 PM
  • INNL

    Innocoll in talks with potential suitor; shares ahead 42%

    • Innocoll Holdings (INNL +41.7%) heads north on a 13x surge in volume in response to its announcement that it is in discussions with an unnamed party concerning a possible acquisition.
    • The company has struggled to get products to the marketplace. It received a CRL in December 2016 from the FDA in response to its XARACOLL marketing application. A month before that, it announced that INL-002 failed to beat standard-of-care treatment in two late-stage studies in patients with diabetic foot ulcers.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:54 PM | 4 Comments
  • TSN

    Avian flu hits second Tennessee breeder farm

    • The Tennessee Department of Agriculture says a second commercial chicken farm in the state has been hit with the highly-pathogenic avian influenza
    • The flock at the location tested positive on March 14.
    • The breeder farm is a supplier for Tyson Foods (TSN -1.9%).
    • Tennessee Department of Agriculture statement
     
     
     
     
    | 3:28 PM
  • GPRO

    GoPro upgraded from Sell to Neutral at Citi

    • Firm cites revenue stabilization and major restructuring as likely accelerating timeline for profitability, while also considering the risk of GoPro (GPRO +14%) accessing its credit facility as reduced. Price target $9 (current price $8.36).
    • Yesterday (March 15, 2017): GoPro +10.3%; Q1 2017 revenue expected at top end of guidance, FY 2017 profitability target reiterated, restructuring planned
     
     
     
     
    | 3:21 PM | 12 Comments
  • MCRB

    Seres on go with late-stage study of lead product candidate to prevent recurrent C. diff infections; shares ahead 34%

    • Thinly traded micro cap Seres Therapeutics (MCRB +34.4%) heads north on a healthy 26x surge in volume in response to its announcement that plans to initiate a Phase 3 clinical trial, ECOSPOR III, evaluating lead product candidate, Breakthrough Therapy- and Orphan Drug-tagged SER-109, for the prevention of recurrent Clostridium difficile (C. diff) infections.
    • The FDA has agreed that this trial could support a regulatory application.
    • SER-109 is a single-dose capsule containing an ecology of bacterial spores enriched and purified from healthy screened human donors. Its keystone organisms address the underlying dysbiosis and returns the microbiome to a healthy state.
    • Previously: Seres Therapeutics' lead product candidate shows positive effect in mid-stage C. diff study; shares ahead 10% premarket (Jan. 31)
     
     
     
     
    | 3:17 PM | 4 Comments
  • CSIQ

    Canadian Solar signs PPAs for solar projects in India

    • Canadian Solar (CSIQ +2.4%) signs 25-year power purchase agreements for 80 MW of solar power projects in the Indian state of Maharashtra with the Solar Energy Corp. of India, the government’s corporate solar arm.
    • CSIQ says it was awarded the projects under a 450 MWac solar capacity tender in the state of Maharashtra through a competitive auction process; the projects are scheduled to begin operations by late 2017.
    • CSIQ’s Indian pipeline now stands at 110 MWac, which CEO Shawn Qu says represents a “significant milestone in one of the world’s fastest-growing renewables markets.”
     
     
     
     
    | 3:16 PM | 9 Comments

  • Technology - Top Gainers / Losers as of 3:00 pm

    • Gainers: IPAS +21%. NH +19%. IPDN +17%. INVE +15%. ISNS +13%.
    • Losers: DPW -22%. AVID -16%. AXTI -14%. OTC:VLTC -11%. NTIP -9%.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:00 PM

  • Session loss for euro disappears after ECB member talks rate hike

    • A rate increase could be on the way, says ECB Governing Council member Ewald Nowotny (from Austria).
    • Of particular interest, he says the ECB could do the opposite of the Fed, and increase benchmark rates before ending QE.
    • Down for most of the session, the euro (NYSEARCA:FXE) has jumped about 30 pips, now higher by 0.1%.
    • ETFs: FXE, EUO, ERO, DRR, ULE, EUFX, URR
     
     
     
     
    | 2:57 PM | 1 Comment
  • SNAP

    Snap falls below $20 for first time

    • Snap (NYSE:SNAP) is down 4.38% to slip below $20 for the first time since the IPO.
    • TheStreet.com reported earlier today that Snap could face some investor lawsuits over the high level of non-voting shares issued as part of the public launch.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:25 PM | 99 Comments
  • WMK

    Grocery store stocks extend post-CPI gains

    • Grocery store stocks continue to rally after yesterday's report on consumer prices showed a drop in food prices (-1.1% Y/Y).
    • A larger gap between grocery store prices and restaurant menu prices helps stoke demand for the chains.
    • Gainers include Weis Markets (WMK +1.7%), Whole Foods Market (WFM +1.3%), Sprouts Farmers Market (SFM +5.6%), Kroger (KR +1.7%) and Ingles Markets (IMKTA +0.9%).
    • Previously: Core CPI rises in-line with forecasts (March 15)
     
     
     
     
    | 2:04 PM | 18 Comments

  • Energy/Materials - Top Gainers / Losers as of 2:00 pm

    • Gainers: SXC +9%. SPP +7%. PACD +7%. SXCP +7%. AXAS +6%.
    • Losers: TELL -13%. DELT -7%. BCEI -6%. CELP -5%. ECT -5%.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:03 PM
  • PACD

    Pacific Drilling +6% as proposals suggest $3.2B in debt converted to equity

    • Pacific Drilling (PACD +6.1%) flies higher after an update on negotiations with its creditors suggests that some of its current equity could survive.
    • After turning down a proposal that would leave shareholders with a 33% stake in a reorganized company, creditors propose converting all PACD debt into a 98% equity stake but also providing existing shareholders with warrants that could give them another 20% of the company.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:55 PM
  • AXTI

    AXT -15.2%, fire at Beijing facility impacts manufacturing production

    • AXT (NASDAQ:AXTI) reports an electrical short-circuit fire at a production area for gallium arsenide and germanium crystal growth at the company's Beijing plant, leading to suspension of all wafer substrate processing.
    • Though no injuries or structural damage were realized, the production halt has AXT recalculating Q1 2017 revenue guidance to $18M-$18.5M, compared to $19.5M-$20.5M anticipated prior.
    • Considering the event a near-term concern and longer-term growth prospects intact, Needham & Company analyst Edwin Mok reissues shares at Buy with an $8.50 target (current price $6.30).
     
     
     
     
    | 1:13 PM | 10 Comments
  • UTHR

    Credit Suisse negative on United Therapeutics; shares slip 4%

    • United Therapeutics (UTHR -4.4%) goes south on modestly higher volume on the heels of an Underperform rating and $120 (14% downside risk) price target by Credit Suisse.
    • Analyst Alethia Young cites valuation and potential negative catalysts including a potential invalidity decision on its '393 patent (being challenged by SteadyMed) and a delay of RemoSynch approval due to the possible delay in the approval of the Medtronic device that will be used in the product.
    • Source: Bloomberg
     
     
     
     
    | 1:11 PM | 4 Comments
  • ATI

    Allegheny Tech upgraded to Buy at Seaport as selloff overdone

    • Allegheny Tech (ATI +3.3%) is upgraded to Buy from Neutral with a $22 price target at Seaport Global, which says the stock's selloff since an initial big bump that followed better than expected Q4 results is overdone.
    • Seaport says ATI long has been strongly correlated to the price of nickel, but in the past two years the company has meaningfully reduced the size of its flat rolled segment; the firm thinks the aerospace-dominated high performance segment will be the key driver of future earnings growth, decoupling the stock from nickel prices.
    • The firm also sees potential upside for the stock given that guidance assumes only 42 of Boeing’s 737 aircraft are produced per month, while Boeing has already said it will go to 47.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:07 PM | 1 Comment
  • WYNN

    Wynn +3% on takeover chatter

    • Down earlier in the session, Wynn Resorts (WYNN +2.9%) has spiked higher amid some Twitter chatter about a $120-$125 per share offer from Las Vegas Sands (LVS +0.6%).
    • UPDATE: Shares of Wynn have peeled back after the company says there is no truth to the M&A speculation making the rounds. WYNN +1.77%.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:53 PM | 64 Comments

  • Midday Gainers / Losers

    • Gainers: TOPS +117%. GLBS +67%. INNL +35%. MCRB +32%. SINO +21%. NH +18%. AGRX +15%. GPRO +15%. ADPT +15%. DAC +12%.
    • Losers: TROV -24%. CDNA -21%. WAC -19%. ARTX -19%. DPW -18%. OTC:VLTC -16%. AVID -16%. PTHN -16%. AXTI -15%. PTCT -14%.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:49 PM | 11 Comments
  • ROSG-OLD

    Rosetta Genomics shareholders OK 12-fold reduction in number shares; post-split trading commences tomorrow; shares ease 7%

    • Rosetta Genomics (ROSG-OLD -6.6%) shareholders have blessed its proposed 1:12 reverse split of its common stock. Post-split trading starts tomorrow.
    • Previously: Rosetta Genomics to reverse split shares 1:12 (March 13)
     
     
     
     
    | 12:32 PM | 5 Comments

  • Consumers - Top 5 Gainers / Losers as of 12:25

    • Gainers: GPRO +15%. OTIV +11%. THST +6%. OXM +5%. DTEA +5%.
    • Losers: BGS -7%. PRMW -6%.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:25 PM
  • DAC

    Shipping stocks break higher

    • Some shipping stocks are notably higher as various shipping rates continue to improve.
    • Shares of Danaos Corporation (NYSE:DAC) shoot up 12% to $1.85 on strong volume. The 52-week range on Danaos is $1.60 to $4.90.
    • Euroseas (NASDAQ:ESEA) is 13% higher to $1.16 vs. a 52-week trading range of $1.04 to $8.07.
    • DryShips (NASDAQ:DRYS) is up 6% to $1.81. The company has fired off several reverse stock splits making comparisons tricky..
    • Star Bulk Carriers (NASDAQ:SBLK) jumps 7% to hit $10.82 vs. a 52-week trading range of $2.61 to $11.14.
    • Costamare (NYSE:CMRE) gains 5% to $6.79 vs. a 52-week trading range of $5.07 to $11.00.
    • Other movers include Scorpio Bulkers (SB +0.6%), Seaenergy Maritime Holdings (SHIP +9.8%), Diana Shipping (DSX +3%) and Globus Maritime (GLBS +61.9%).
     
     
     
     
    | 12:01 PM | 22 Comments
  • INNL

    Trading suspended in Innocoll pending news; shares up 35%

    • Nasdaq has halted traded in Innocoll Holdings (INNL +35.1%) pending the release of news.
    • Shares plummeted in December after the FDA rejected its marketing application for postsurgical pain med XARACOLL.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:48 AM | 7 Comments
  • PRMW

    Primo Water lower after posting Q4 results

    • Primo Water (PRMW -6.3%) trades lower after Q4 EPS falls short of the consensus estimate, even as EBITDA topped the company's guidance.
    • Gross margin fell 40 bpds to 28.6% of sales as a shift in sales mix factored in.
    • Looking ahead, Primo expects 2017 revenue of $280M to $285M and EBITDA of $52M to $54M.
    • Shares of Primo peaked at a 52-week high of $15.39 in February.
    • Previously: Primo Water misses by $0.05, beats on revenue (March 15)
     
     
     
     
    | 11:47 AM
  • LITE

    Lumentum upgraded to Neutral at Goldman Sachs

    • Positive on 3D sensing prospects given likely incorporation of the technology among upcoming flagship smartphone models, analyst Doug Clark raises from Conviction Sell. Target from $38 to $45.
    • Lumentum (NASDAQ:LITE) $48.30, +5.81%.
    • Earlier (March 16, 2017): Infinera upgraded to Buy at Goldman Sachs; +3.96% / Goldman Sachs reduces Ciena to Neutral
     
     
     
     
    | 11:35 AM

  • Healthcare - Top 5 Gainers / Losers as of 11:20

    • Gainers: INNL +35%. MCRB +32%. ADPT +18%. AGRX +13%. CGIX +11%.
    • Losers: TROV -24%. PTHN -15%. CPRX -12%. PTCT -11%. INO -10%.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:20 AM | 2 Comments
  • TELL

    Tellurian -10% on plans to sell $200M in stock

    • Tellurian (TELL -10.3%) plunges ~10% after filing to sell common stock for up to $200M in sales proceeds.
    • Just last month, TELL filed for a mixed securities shelf offering as well as a potential offering of ~500K common shares.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:18 AM | 5 Comments
  • TOL

    Homebuilders outperform as housing starts top expectations

    • February housing starts rose 3% from January to a seasonally adjusted annualized rate of 1.288M. Estimates were for 1.26M. While permits dipped 6% in February, they're still higher by more than 4% Y/Y.
    • Of note, however, was an unusually warm February, and one wonders what gains last month may be taken away by what's become a pretty harsh March.
    • The major averages are flat on the session, but the ITB is higher by 1.4%, and XHB 0.8%.
    • Toll Brothers (TOL +1.7%), KB Home (KBH +1.8%), Pulte (PHM +1.3%), D.R. Horton (DHI +1.2%), Lennar (LEN +1.1%)
     
     
     
     
    | 10:56 AM | 3 Comments

  • Natural gas futures go south on less than expected inventory draw

    • EIA Natural Gas Inventory: -53 Bcf vs. -56 Bcf consensus, -68 Bcf last week. Futures -2.8% to $2.898.
    • ETFs: UNG, DGAZ, UGAZ, BOIL, GAZ, KOLD, UNL, DCNG
     
     
     
     
    | 10:32 AM | 25 Comments
  • MRK

    Trump's proposed 2018 budget trims NIH funding 20%; healthcare stocks in the red

    • Healthcare stocks are under pressure in early trading on the heels of the Trump administration's release of its proposed 2018 budget that includes a 20% haircut for the National Institutes of Health (NIH) to $5.8B. Observers and legislators were expecting an increase of $1B - 2B.
    • The White House's budget also includes a major reorganization of NIH's institutes and centers to "help focus resources on the highest priority research and training activities."
    • NIH funds ~300K scientists worldwide.
    • ETFs: (IBB -0.7%)(BIB -1.5%)(BIS +1.6%)(CNCR +0.5%)(ARKG -0.4%)(PJP -0.3%)(IHE -0.3%)(XPH -0.1%)(PPH -0.1%)(IHI -0.8%)(XHE -0.4%)
    • Cross-section of tickers: (MRK -0.5%)(PFE -0.7%)(AMGN -1.5%)(BIIB -4.1%)(GILD +0.1%)(ILMN -3.7%)(MDT -0.8%)(BSX -0.9%)(ABT -0.8%)(TMO -2.4%)
     
     
     
     
    | 10:11 AM | 286 Comments
  • FMNB

    Farmers National Bancorp to buy Monitor Bancorp

    • Based on the current estimate for tangible book value at Monitor, the cash and stock deal would be valued at about $7.8M.
    • FMNB +0.35% in early action today.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:01 AM
  • IBM

    IBM raised to $212 target at Morgan Stanley, cloud cited undervalued

    • Noting public cloud units at Amazon and Microsoft are generally modeled, and valued, in line with characteristic adoption cycle (base case), firm suggests IBM (IBM +1.2%) exists external of similar classification.
    • Expects IBM's public cloud operation to expand at a 33% 2016-2020 CAGR, with gross and operating margins to trend in line with average industry figures by 2020, though notes calculations as prospectively conservative.
    • Price target from $187 (current price $177.90).
     
     
     
     
    | 10:00 AM | 6 Comments
  • RNVA

    Rennova inks discounted convertible debt deal with institutional investors; shares slip 8%

    • Nano cap Rennova Health (OTCPK:RNVA -7.7%) eases on a 50% spike on volume in response to its agreement with institutional investors that will allow them to exchange their holdings for new debentures at a 24% discount.
    • Under the terms of the Securities Purchase Agreement, the company will issue $10.85M of two-year Senior Secured Original Issue Discount Convertible Debentures and three series of warrants to purchase common shares. Gross proceeds should be $8.75M. Closing date is March 20.
    • In the simultaneous Exchange Agreement, the holder of its Original Issue Discount Convertible Debentures issued on February 2, 2017 will be able to exchange the debt for the new issue as will the holder of its Series H Convertible Preferred Stock. All issuance amounts reflect the above discount.
    • The debentures can be converted at any time for $1.66 per common share.
    • Yesterday's close was $1.96.
     
     
     
     
    | 9:53 AM | 1 Comment
  • FEIM

    Frequency Electronics reports FQ3 results

    • Frequency Electronics (NASDAQ:FEIM): FQ3 EPS of $0.04
    • Revenue of $12.8M (-5.2% Y/Y)
    • Shares +4.5%.
    • Press Release
     
     
     
     
    | 9:49 AM
  • BEN

    BEN boosted by upgrade

    • This just in: Amid a near-constant stream of bad news for traditional asset managers, Franklin Resources (NYSE:BEN) is higher by nearly 50% since its 2016 low hit right around July 4.
    • BAML analyst Michael Carrier climbs on board, upgrading to Buy from Neutral. His $50 price target suggests another 16% upside from yesterday's close.
    • Carrier expects better organic growth thanks to improving relative performance at the company's major funds.
    • There's also the potential for cash repatriation (and associated buybacks/boosted dividends), a "less burdensome" fiduciary rule, and an emphasis on cost controls.
    • Shares +2.7% today to $44.17.
     
     
     
     
    | 9:42 AM | 1 Comment
  • TSN

    Tyson Foods slips after Argus downgrade

    • Argus downgrades Tyson Foods (NYSE:TSN) to a Hold rating after having the consumer goods stock set at Buy.
    • Tyson has opened trading down 1.58%. Shares of Tyson have swung back and forth in a tight $62 to $65 range for most of the last ten weeks.
     
     
     
     
    | 9:36 AM | 2 Comments
  • TROV

    Trovagene laying almost 60% of workforce; shares slip 17% premarket

    • Liquid biopsy firm Trovagene (NASDAQ:TROV) slumps 17% premarket on management's disclosure that it will lay off 30 of its 53 employees as part of its restructuring related to its "expansion" into cancer therapeutics. The company expects to save ~$8M in annual expenses from the action.
    • Previously: Trovagene nabs rights to leukemia candidate from Nerviano Medical (March 15)
     
     
     
     
    | 9:25 AM | 26 Comments

  • Premarket Gainers as of 9:10 am

    • SKLN +13% on Q4 earnings.
    • OCRX +12%.
    • GPRO +11% on increased guidance and restructuring for 2017.
    • JASO +10% on Q4 earnings beat.
    • ALRM +9% on Q4 earnings beat.
    • CERU +7%.
    • IDRA +8% on Q4 earnings beat.
    • AKG +8% on Q4 earnings.
    • ITEK +7% on FY earnings.
    • ORCL +7% on Q3 earnings beat and increased dividend.
    • KCG +6% on non-binding proposal by Virtu.
    • CLRB +5% on Q4 earnings.
     
     
     
     
    | 9:20 AM | 1 Comment
  • NUE

    Nucor +3% premarket after guiding Q1 earnings far above consensus

    • Nucor (NYSE:NUE) +3.3% premarket after issuing upside guidance for Q1 earnings, seeing EPS of $1.10-$1.15 vs. $0.69 analyst consensus estimate; Q4 EPS came in at $0.50, and Q1 2016 EPS was $0.27.
    • NUE credits the expected improvement to higher profitability in its steel mills segment, and says it is encouraged by renewed growth in demand in the non-residential construction and energy markets.
    • NUE says it recently resumed operations in Louisiana after an unplanned outage that began in early February caused by an equipment failure; NUE says it also completed planned maintenance that was scheduled for later in the year.
    • On watch: X, AKS, CMC, MT, STLD, SLX
     
     
     
     
    | 9:13 AM | 3 Comments
  • GKOS

    U.S reimbursement codes covering Glaukos' iStent extended for five years; shares ahead 6% premarket

    • Glaukos (NYSE:GKOS) is up 6% premarket, albeit on only 859 shares, in response to its announcement that the CPT codes used by physicians for reimbursement for implanting the iStent device have been extended five years.
    • CEO Thomas Burns says, “The AMA CPT Editorial Panel’s decision to grant these extensions is important to the continued surgeon adoption of iStent and MIGS, a new technology class we pioneered to provide glaucoma patients a viable potential alternative to daily, multi-dose prescription eye drops or complex surgeries. As we pursue FDA approval of our next-generation iStent technologies, we are pleased to have the corresponding CPT codes already in place and will use this time to continue to build upon the growing body of published research that documents their clinical performance.”
     
     
     
     
    | 9:10 AM
  • CLSN

    Celsion EPS and revenue in-line

    • Celsion (NASDAQ:CLSN): FY EPS of -$0.85 in-line.
    • Revenue of $0.5M in-line (flat Y/Y).
    • Shares +11.7% PM.
    • Press Release
     
     
     
     
    | 9:02 AM
  • SNOA

    Small dermatitis study of Sonoma Pharma's SebuDerm shows treatment effect; shares ahead 3% premarket

    • Thinly traded nano cap Sonoma Pharmaceuticals (NASDAQ:SNOA) perks up 3% premarket on light volume in response to its announcement of positive results from a 25-subject study evaluating SebuDerm (topical hypochlorous acid) gel for the treatment of mild-to-moderate facial and scalp seborrheic dermatitis. The data will be presented at the 13th Annual Maui Dermatology Conference in Hawaii, March 20 - 24.
    • Treated patients showed a 33% improvement from baseline at day 14 and 52% improvement at day 28 as measured by investigator's global assessment (IGA). The improvement from baseline at 28 was 62% as measured by subject global assessment (SGA).
    • U.S. commercialization is underway via the company's direct salesforce. Distribution partners are being recruited ex-U.S.
     
     
     
     
    | 9:02 AM

  • Post-Fed gold rally continues

    • Gold traders continue to "buy the news" after selling the rumor of a Fed rate hike for the previous two weeks.
    • Advancing further this morning, gold is now up to $1,232 per ounce vs. $1,200 prior to the Fed rate hike yesterday afternoon.

    Guess to shrink U.S. business after weak results

    • Guess (NYSE:GES) falls in early trading after Q4 numbers trailed estimates.

    • JA Solar (NASDAQ:JASO) +6.6% premarket after reporting solid Q4 results, including better than expected revenues and external shipments rising 5.5% Y/Y and 13.8% Q/Q to 1.4 GW.

  • PTCT

    PTC acquires DMD med Emflaza from Marathon Pharma for up to $190M

    • PTC Therapeutics (NASDAQ:PTCT) inks an agreement with privately held Marathon Pharmaceuticals, LLC to acquire all rights to Emflaza (deflazacort), approved last month by the FDA to treat Duchenne muscular dystrophy (DMD).
    • Under the terms of the asset purchase agreement, PTC will pay Marathon $140M upfront ($75M in cash + $65M in PTC common stock) and annual sales-based payments (low-to-mid-twenty percent) beginning in 2018. Marathon also has the opportunity to receive a single $50M sales-based milestone.
    • PTC says the deal, expected to close in Q2, will be accretive to earnings and cash flow beginning in 2018.
    • Previously: Marathon Pharma prices DMD med deflazacort 70x higher than ex-U.S. price (Feb. 10)
    • Previously: FDA OKs an anti-inflammatory med to treat Duchenne muscular dystrophy (Feb. 9)
    • Update: Shares are down 6% premarket on average volume.

    Dollar General battles through retail pressure

    • Dollar General (NYSE:DG) reports comparable sales increased 1.0% in Q4 to top the consensus estimate for a 0.3% gain. Strength in the consumables and home products categories is cited.
    • Gross margin came in at 31.6% of sales vs. 31.3% consensus and 31.8% a year ago.
    • The company paid an effective tax rate of 36.8% in the quarter, compared to 36.1% a year ago.
    • Merchandise inventories fell 0.7% on a per-store basis to $3.26B.
